variables.description: Boolean if a class name for each color should be created.

usedBy.description:
Themes the pickers with the new colors only if the `primary-color` does not equal the `md-primary-color`,
or the `light-theme` does not equal the `md-light-theme` and at least one of `include-date` or `include-time`
are true.

context.name: react-md-theme-pickers

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for the the date picker only.

context.name: react-md-pickers-time

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for expansion panels.

context.name: react-md-expansion-panels

usedBy.description: This will include the styles for a discrete Slider.

context.name: react-md-discrete-slider

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for chips. The remove, avatar, and contact styles can be excluded.
If the `$include-contact` param is true, the avatar styles will always be included even
if `$include-avatar` is false.

context.name: react-md-chips

usedBy.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-color--text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-color--secondary-text - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-color--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-color--primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-color--primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

context.name: react-md-colors

usedBy.description: Generates the box shadow for material design

context.name: md-box-shadow

usedBy.description: This will include the styles for a discrete Slider.

context.name: react-md-discrete-slider

usedBy.description:
Styles a bottom navigation that is colored to update the `.md-background--primary` color to a new color. It also will
optionally update the label's color and the ink's color if they do not equal the defaults. This is mostly used when
you want to update the navigation drawer's color when a new tab is clicked.

context.name: react-md-theme-bottom-navigations-colored

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for chips. The remove, avatar, and contact styles can be excluded.
If the `$include-contact` param is true, the avatar styles will always be included even
if `$include-avatar` is false.

context.name: react-md-chips

usedBy.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-color--text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-color--secondary-text - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-color--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-color--primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-color--primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

context.name: react-md-colors

usedBy.description: This includes the react-md Sliders Component scss.

context.name: react-md-sliders

usedBy.description: This will include the styles for a discrete Slider.

context.name: react-md-discrete-slider

usedBy.description:
This will theme the Slider component with an updated `primary-color` and
optionally a switch in themes.

context.name: react-md-theme-sliders

usedBy.description: Includes the stiles for tabs.

context.name: react-md-tabs

usedBy.description:
Includes the css for the input / textarea tags for text fields. This is normally
used only within the `react-md-text-fields` mixin.

context.name: react-md-text-field

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for toolbars.

context.name: react-md-toolbars

usedBy.description:
Updates the toolbar's `themed` color ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme` and the `$include-themed` param is `true`.

context.name: react-md-theme-toolbars

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for tooltips.

context.name: react-md-tooltips

variables.description:
This is a map of all the material design base colors
so that you can programatically get variables with the
neat sass-map functions.

context.name: md-color-map

usedBy.description:
A utility function to take a color and get a different swatch/accent color
in the same family.

context.name: get-swatch

usedBy.description:
This will create two class names for every material design color. The first
class name can be used to style any text with that color, while the other will
be used to style the background color.

context.name: react-md-color-class-names

usedBy.description:
A helper function to validate that a `$primary-color` has a `-200` suffix when
using the dark theme. It doesn't actually output anything with sass-loader atm
though. :/

context.name: validate-slider-primary-color

usedBy.description: Includes the css for using `md-icon`.

context.name: react-md-icons

usedBy.description:
Updates the color of the base `md-icon` if the `$light-theme` paramater
does not equal the global `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-icons

usedBy.description: Includes the css for the Avatars.

context.name: react-md-avatars

usedBy.description:
This includes the css for simple typography in react-md. It will
update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font
family, set the line-height, text-rendering, and create the base
class names for the typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` is true,
the `h1` - `h6`, `p`, and `caption` tags will be updated with the
corresponding css class name.

context.name: react-md-typography

usedBy.description: Includes the css for using `md-icon`.

context.name: react-md-icons

usedBy.description:
Updates the color of the base `md-icon` if the `$light-theme` paramater
does not equal the global `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-icons

usedBy.description: Includes the css for the Avatars.

context.name: react-md-avatars

usedBy.description: This includes the react-md Sliders Component scss.

context.name: react-md-sliders

usedBy.description: This will include the styles for a discrete Slider.

context.name: react-md-discrete-slider

usedBy.description:
This will theme the Slider component with an updated `primary-color` and
optionally a switch in themes.

context.name: react-md-theme-sliders

usedBy.description:
This includes the css for simple typography in react-md. It will
update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font
family, set the line-height, text-rendering, and create the base
class names for the typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` is true,
the `h1` - `h6`, `p`, and `caption` tags will be updated with the
corresponding css class name.

context.name: react-md-typography

variables.description: A mapping of all the light-theme colors.

context.name: md-light-theme-colors
context.value:
(
  text: $md-light-theme-text-color,
  secondary: $md-light-theme-secondary-text-color,
  icon: $md-light-theme-icon-text-color,
  disabled: $md-light-theme-disabled-text-color,
  hint: $md-light-theme-hint-text-color,
  divider: $md-light-theme-divider-color,
  background: $md-light-theme-background-color,
  card: $md-light-theme-card-color,
  hover: $md-light-theme-divider-color,
  toolbar: $md-light-theme-app-bar-color,
)

usedBy.description: A utility function for getting a color from either the light or dark theme.

context.name: get-color

variables.description: A mapping of all the dark-theme colors.

context.name: md-dark-theme-colors
context.value:
(
  text: $md-dark-theme-text-color,
  secondary: $md-dark-theme-secondary-text-color,
  icon: $md-dark-theme-icon-text-color,
  disabled: $md-dark-theme-disabled-text-color,
  hint: $md-dark-theme-hint-text-color,
  divider: $md-dark-theme-divider-color,
  background: $md-dark-theme-background-color,
  card: $md-dark-theme-card-color,
  hover: rgba($md-black-base, .12),
  toolbar: $md-dark-theme-app-bar-color,
)

usedBy.description: A utility function for getting a color from either the light or dark theme.

context.name: get-color

functions.description: A utility function for getting a color from either the light or dark theme.

context.name: get-color

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The color name to look up.

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if it is for the light theme.

return.description:
the color for the theme or null if it is not a color that changes
    based on the theme.

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for autocompletes depending on the theme.

context.name: react-md-autocompletes

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles for the autocompletes ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not
equal the `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-autocompletes

usedBy.description:
This will only update the base avatar's border color if the `$light-theme` is different than
`$md-light-theme`. If you want to add different colors, you should use the `react-md-theme-avatar`
mixin.

context.name: react-md-theme-avatars

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for material design buttons. Each button type can optionally
be excluded. However, if the `floating` styles are included, the `icon` styles
will also be included.

context.name: react-md-buttons

usedBy.description:
Themes the buttons ONLY when the `$primary-color` does not equal the `$md-primary-color`,
the `$secondary-color` does not equal the `$md-secondary-color`, or the `$md-light-theme`
does not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-buttons

usedBy.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-color--text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-color--secondary-text - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-color--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-color--primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-color--primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

context.name: react-md-colors

usedBy.description:
This will conditionally update theme colors. The theme colors will only
be updated if their value does not equal the global value.

context.name: react-md-theme-colors

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles for data tables only if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme`. The only styles realy updated are the border colors and the
hover/selected row background colors.

context.name: react-md-theme-data-tables

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a row in the data table.

context.name: react-md-data-table-rows

usedBy.description: Includes the Divider styles

context.name: react-md-dividers

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles and class names for creating a divider through
the border property. This will create the following class names:

- md-divider-border
  - the base class that applies the color and border style.
- md-divider-border--top
  - only includes a border above the element.
- md-divider-border--right
  - only includes a border to the right of the element.
- md-divider-border--bottom
  - only includes a border below the element.
- md-divider-border--left
  - only includes a border to the left of the element.

context.name: react-md-divider-borders

usedBy.description:
Updates the background color of dividers ONLY if the `$light-theme` does
not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-dividers

usedBy.description: Themes only the divider borders if the `$light-theme` does not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-divider-borders

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for expansion panels.

context.name: react-md-expansion-panels

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles for expansion panels based on the `light-theme` param.
If `light-theme` equals `md-light-theme`, no styles will be created.

context.name: react-md-theme-expansion-panels

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for material design ink.

context.name: react-md-inks

usedBy.description:
Themes the ink color for the given theme ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-inks

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for lists.

context.name: react-md-lists

usedBy.description: Updates the theme for lists ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the `$md-light-theme`.

context.name: react-md-theme-lists

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for the media overlay.

context.name: react-md-media-overlay

usedBy.description:
Themes the pickers with the new colors only if the `primary-color` does not equal the `md-primary-color`,
or the `light-theme` does not equal the `md-light-theme` and at least one of `include-date` or `include-time`
are true.

context.name: react-md-theme-pickers

usedBy.description:
Includes the base styles for pickers. This is styles that is used for both date and time pickers.
This is normally used within the `react-md-pickers` mixin.

context.name: react-md-pickers-base

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for the the date picker only.

context.name: react-md-pickers-date

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for the the date picker only.

context.name: react-md-pickers-time

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for a tab only. This should probably not be used since it
is included in the `react-md-tabs` mixin.

context.name: react-md-tabs-tab

usedBy.description: Themes all parts of the text fields if they are included.

context.name: react-md-theme-text-fields

usedBy.description:
Includes only the `md-text-field-container` css. This should normally be used from
the `react-md-text-fields` mixin. The placeholders will also be styled accordingly.

context.name: react-md-text-field-container

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for the text field's floating label.

context.name: react-md-text-field-floating-label

usedBy.description:
Modifies the styles of the text-field-floating-label ONLY if:
- the `$primary-color` is different than `$md-primary-color`
- the `$light-theme` is different than `$md-light-theme`
- the `$error-color` is different than `$md-error-color`.

In most cases, you should use the `react-md-theme-text-fields` mixin instead.

context.name: react-md-theme-text-field-floating-label

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for the text field message / counter component.

context.name: react-md-text-field-message

usedBy.description:
Modifies the styles of the text-field-message ONLY if:
- the `$light-theme` is different than `$md-light-theme`
- the `$error-color` is different than `$md-text-field-error-color`

In most cases, you should use the `react-md-theme-text-fields` mixin instead.

context.name: react-md-theme-text-field-message

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for using icons with text fields. This is really only useful if you did
not use the `react-md-text-fields` mixin.

context.name: react-md-text-field-icon

usedBy.description:
Modifies the styles of the text-field-icon ONLY if:
- the `$primary-color` is different than `$md-primary-color`
- the `$light-theme` is different than `$md-light-theme`
- the `$error-color` is different than `$md-error-color`.

In most cases, you should use the `react-md-theme-text-fields` mixin instead.

context.name: react-md-theme-text-field-icon

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for having a password text field.

context.name: react-md-text-field-password

usedBy.description:
Modifies the styles of the text-field-password ONLY if the value of `$light-theme` is
different than the `$md-light-theme`. This is only useful if you have a part of your app
that is `dark-theme` while another section is not. In most cases, you should use the
`react-md-theme-text-fields` mixin instead.

context.name: react-md-theme-text-field-password

usedBy.description: Includes the styles for toolbars.

context.name: react-md-toolbars

usedBy.description:
Updates the toolbar's `themed` color ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal the
`$md-light-theme` and the `$include-themed` param is `true`.

context.name: react-md-theme-toolbars

usedBy.description:
This includes the css for simple typography in react-md. It will
update all items to use `box-sizing: border-box`, set the font
family, set the line-height, text-rendering, and create the base
class names for the typography. If the `$extend-html-tags` is true,
the `h1` - `h6`, `p`, and `caption` tags will be updated with the
corresponding css class name.

context.name: react-md-typography

usedBy.description:
Updates the theme of the typography ONLY if the `$light-theme` does not equal `$md-light-theme`.
You will need to apply this `$html-class-name` to the `html` tag to get the effects. This is because
the base `html` tag had the background color set which everything inherits.

context.name: react-md-theme-typography

functions.description:
A utility function to take a color and get a different swatch/accent color
in the same family.

context.name: get-swatch

parameter.name: color
parameter.description: The material design color to get a swatch for.

parameter.name: accent
parameter.description: Boolean if the swatch is the accent color.

return.description: the color with the correct swatch.

usedBy.description: Creates the styles for a linear progress bar.

context.name: react-md-progress-linear

usedBy.description:
Themes only the linear progress bars when the `$secondary-color` does not equal
the `$md-secondary-color` OR the `$swatch` does not equal the `$md-linear-progress-swatch`.

context.name: react-md-theme-progress-linear

usedBy.description:
Includes the styles for the Selection Controls' switch only. The `$secondary-color` will
automatically be switched to the `-500` swatch in light themes and the `-200` swatch
in dark themes.

context.name: react-md-selection-controls-switch

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles for switches ONLY if
- the `$secondary-color` does not equal the `$md-secondary-color`
- the `$light-theme` does not equal the `$md-light-theme`

The `$secondary-color` will automatically be updated to be a swatch of `-500` for light themes
and a swatch of `-200` for dark themes.

context.name: react-md-theme-selection-controls-switch

mixins.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-color--text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-color--secondary-text - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-color--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-color--primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-color--primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

context.name: react-md-colors

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

parameter.name: include-color-class-names
parameter.description:
Boolean if a class name
    should be created for every color as well.

usedBy.description:
Includes every component, transition, and typography including their
media queries if the `$md-media-included` variable is `true`. You can
modify any global variables before including this mixin to change the overall
theme.

context.name: react-md-everything

mixins.description:
This will conditionally update theme colors. The theme colors will only
be updated if their value does not equal the global value.

context.name: react-md-theme-colors

parameter.name: light-theme
parameter.description: Boolean if styling with the light theme.

usedBy.description:
Updates the styles of every component with the new theme colors. If there
are components that do not change if the `$light-theme` variable is the same,
their updated styles will not be included. This is useful if you want to switch
between the light or dark theme, or even the entire theme colors while keeping
the base css the same between all themes.

In addition, if the theme colors do not switch, those styles will not be created.
So this allows the same colors between light and dark themes.

If you switch between the light and dark theme, you will need to give a `$html-class-name`
That will nest every component inside.

context.name: react-md-theme-everything

mixins.description:
This will create two class names for every material design color. The first
class name can be used to style any text with that color, while the other will
be used to style the background color.

context.name: react-md-color-class-names

usedBy.description:
A mixin for generating the base color class names to be used
on multiple components. This will generate the following class names:
- md-color--text - Styles the `color` to be the text color.
- md-color--secondary-text - Styles the `color` to be the secondary text color.
- md-color--disabled - Styles the `color` to be the disabled text color.
- md-color--primary - Styles the `color` to be the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary - Styles the `color` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background - Styles the `background` to be the base background color.
- md-background--primary - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color.
- md-background--primary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `primary` color with some opacity.
- md-background--secondary - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color.
- md-background--secondary-hover - Styles the `background` to be the `secondary` color with some opacity.
- md-color--primary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `primary` color.
- md-color--secondary-ink - Styles any ink inside this class to use the `secondary` color.

context.name: react-md-colors
